name: mitodetect-mitochondrial-variants
title: MitoDetect: Mitochondrial Variant Detection
description: nf-core/mitodetect is a bioinformatics pipeline for A-Z analysis of mitochondrial NGS data. It performs read quality control with FastQC and MultiQC, enabling comprehensive mitochondrial variant detection from next-generation sequencing data.
content:
Introduction

nf-core/mitodetect is a bioinformatics pipeline for A-Z analysis of mitochondrial NGS data. This pipeline provides comprehensive analysis of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA) from next-generation sequencing data, enabling detection of variants, heteroplasmy levels, and other mitochondrial genomic features.

The pipeline is built using Nextflow, a workflow tool to run tasks across multiple compute infrastructures in a very portable manner. It uses Docker / Singularity containers making installation trivial and results highly reproducible.

Pipeline Summary

The pipeline performs the following analysis steps:

  • Read Quality Control (QC) - Uses FastQC to assess the quality of raw sequencing reads

  • Comprehensive Quality Reporting - Employs MultiQC to aggregate quality control results across all samples

  • Mitochondrial Variant Detection - Specialized analysis of mtDNA variants including heteroplasmy detection

  • Standardized Reporting - Generates publication-ready reports and visualizations

Key Features

  • Built with Nextflow DSL2, using containerized processes for reproducibility and portability

  • Specialized for mitochondrial DNA analysis with optimized variant calling

  • Supports heteroplasmy detection for mixed mitochondrial populations

  • Comprehensive quality control with FastQC and MultiQC integration

  • Compatible with standard NGS data formats and reference genomes

Usage

  1. Prepare a samplesheet.csv with your input sequencing data (FASTQ files)

  2. Run the pipeline with appropriate parameters

nextflow run nf-core/mitodetect \
  -profile <docker/singularity/...> \
  --input samplesheet.csv \
  --outdir <OUTDIR>

Applications

This pipeline is ideal for:

  • Mitochondrial disease research and diagnostics

  • Population genetics studies of mtDNA

  • Cancer research involving mitochondrial mutations

  • Ancient DNA studies with degraded mitochondrial genomes

  • Quality control of sequencing data targeting mitochondrial regions

For more information, visit the nf-core/mitodetect documentation
